ygData.subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Kunark faction
ygData.msgSnippet: Good Lord! Well, you are probably right about killins sarnaks as I havent killed many of them myself (I just remembered there was good faction involved with
ygData.messageBody:
Good Lord!

Well, you are probably right about killins sarnaks as I havent killed many
of them myself (I just remembered there was good faction involved with
them). Where are you turning in the watcher torches? I carried a couple of
backpacks around with me, hoping there was someplace in Calibis that I could
turn them in, but alas Calibis is overrun with crusaders and they didnt take
kindly to my presence. I'd also be interested in what factions there are in
Calibis, although I've heard that the bone chip collecting trooper is a good
friend of <all> the internal Calibis factions.

Also, have you tried turning in 4 stacks of 4 bone chips?

Cogg - RZ
----- Original Message -----
From: Mark Rafn <dagon@...>
To: <eqenchanters@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 07, 2000 3:08 PM
Subject: [eqenchanters] Kunark faction


> On Wed, 7 Jun 2000, Garett wrote:
>
> > Not only goblins, but sarnaks as well... both will increase your
> > Firona Vie faction, as well as your factions with the Legions of
> > Calibis (Iksar Troopers).
>
> Are you sure? I've spent a lot of time with my gnecro (level 24 - 29, in
> fact) killing goblins and sarnaks in Warsliks, Overthere, and Lake of Ill
> Omen. Goblins give Firona Vie and Legion of Cabilis, Sarnaks give me ONLY
> Cabilis faction. This may vary in other zones however, or there may be
> some limit at work where I can't get any more FV faction from Sarnaks.
>
> If you're just after faction to get to dubious with the troopers, a good
> place is the newbie area in Warsliks Woods (SE part of zone). lots of
> goblin whelps, scouts, and watchers - just run around taking a whack at
> each and letting your pet finish the job.
>
> On Wed, 7 Jun 2000, Art Jay wrote:
> > Well, even after that and with Alliance cast, the guards are still
scowling.
> > Any ball-park figure on how MANY kills are needed? I'd really like
> > to turn in the couple of dozen brains and torches. ;)
>
> It took about 250 (wild guess) to get to dubious with the Troopers.
> Since then I've killed another hundred fifty or so goblins and sarnaks,
> turned in 2.5 backpacks full of bone chips and over a hundred watcher
> torches. I'm now amiable to the troopers, dubious to at least some
> vendors, and still ready to attack by the crusaders.
>
> I've heard third-hand reports of people turning in 1500 and 2000 bone
> chips before being non-KOS to the crusaders. This isn't too surprising,
> as it's a 4-at-a-time "quest", so that's only 500 points of faction.
> --
> Mark Rafn dagon@... <http://www.dagon.net/>
>
>
